name: DefineStation
filter
start here
template:
Welcome to the first station of your QuestTour
This will guide you around the DoESLiverpool 
hackspace.

Poke the Start button with your index 
finger to move on.  
(Or skip to the coffee maker.)

NextButtonDef: intro,Start,
NextButtonDef: make,Make Coffee,coffee_maker

name: display
template:
This is the display case of stuff 
that has been made by members.

Press skip if you would like to 
move on to the next area.

NextButtonDef: heat,Skip,
NextButtonDef: display,Yes,

name: heat press
template:
Here is the heat press for making T-shirt designs
There is also a mug press.  It uses sublimation
printing to transfer the ink from the paper to
the product.

name: coffee
template:
Finally we reach the coffee station.

Coffee is free to the members and visitors of the hackspace.

If the coffee has run out, would you like to be instructed on how to refill it?

NextButtonDef: donations,No,
NextButtonDef: make,Yes,coffee_maker

name: make coffee
template:
First take the glass coffee pot and 
the filter above it to the sink on your left.

name: donations
template:
This is the donations box to pay for crisps 
cans of coke and other sundries.

name: end
template:
You are at the end of the Augmented Reality DoESTour.

Thank you for participating.

We hope you enjoyed this adventure.

Please click Start to begin again for the next person.

NextButtonDef: start,Start,

name: displayhg
template:
This an aluminium piece for the 
nose wires of a hang-glider.  
It was machined on the router in the next room,

NextButtonDef: heat,Skip,

name: displayvis
template:
During the pandemic DoESLiverpool produced
visors for local health care establishments.

name: vinyl cutter
template:
If you have a 2D design, this machine can cut
it out of vinyl which you can transfer onto any hard surface
like a laptop or a filing cabinet.

name: 3Dprinter
template:
One of the many 3D printers working in the
space.  We charge only the cost of materials.

name: metalworkshop
template:
Stay out.  This place is dangerous.
You might suffocate from the lack of
oxygen or be shredded by the machines.

name: lasercutting
template:
The laser cutting is all done in this room
because the machines are noisy.
It can be boring work because you are not allowed
to leave them unattended in case they catch fire.

So don't be shy.  Go on in and ask what they are making.

name: solderstation
template:
We do all our soldering at this desk.
There probably isn't much to see here.
There are free components scattered around 
everywhere if you know where to look.

name: sewingroom
template:
This way leads to the sewing room. 
There's an embroidery machine and some 
other stuff we don't have time to explain right now.

name: filters
template:
Take a single paper filter from the stack in 
this this cupboard and put it in the filter tray.
There should be a small plastic measuring cup with it.

name: Pour water
template:
Lift the lid here and pour the jug of water through 
into the hatch through the plastic grill.
Then replace the jug onto hot plate.

name: introvid1
template:
This is the introvid1

VideoPlaceTop: SafeARDoESIntro(1)

name: introvid2
template:
This is the introvid2

VideoPlaceRight: SafeARDoESFacilities

name: Intro Script
info:
Cue: Press Button to Start 
(just out of reach) 

***Video: Komal Madar wearing a Quest3 headset

Welcome to DoESLiverpool, a community maker and 
coworking space at the heart of Liverpool.

(Komal takes headset off and looks at camera)

Hi, I'm Komal Madar, and I am inviting you to 
participate in our new experimental tour of our 
space using the power of Augmented Reality technology.

If you feel uncomfortable at any time, simply 
stop and take the headset off.

Now please step forward to click on the next button 
and advance to the next Slide


***Video: Voice of Komal, but cut between the different items

At DoESLiverpool you can rent desks, or pay to 
be a workshop member and use any of our shared 
equipment including laser cutters, 3D printers, 
and sewing machines.

(panning shot of busy evening)

Every Thursday night and one Saturday a month we
have an open event when everything is free to use.


***Video: Voice of Komal, another panning down shot 
to show the place on the floor.

Before we begin we need to check that the room is 
aligned properly.  Look down at the floor ahead of 
you and check if the yellow rectangle is properly 
framing the masking tape on the carpet.

Answer Yes to continue, or No to call for help to get 
it straightened out.

"Does this look right?  (Yes)(No)"


***Video: Komal again

Great.  This tour will lead you through a series of 
check points one at a time.  At each place there will be 
a sign to explain the location or piece of equipment 
that is in front of you.  

Please take your time and take care not trip or bump into 
anything along the way.  Most importantly, enjoy yourself.
I will see you near the end of the tour.

------

name: calibration
template:
Let's make sure everything's working. 

Press the button on this station with your index finger to continue on with the tour.

VideoPlaceTop: SafeARDoESCalibration

name: displaymuseum
template:
This is Museum-in-a-Box.
If you place one of the 3D printed itens on top
it will tell you what it is.

NextButtonDef: heat,Skip,

name: displaymuseum
template:
This is an example of the sort of 
thing you can make with a laser cutter.
Pick it up and take a closer look.

NextButtonDef: heat,Skip,

name: quietroom
template:
Here is a dark quiet room you can use 
for conference calls and meetings.
Sometimes we play VR in here.

name: toilets
template:
There are two toilets, 
here and across the step.
If they are in use and you can't wait, 
there's another couple downstairs.

name: nook
template:
The nook used to be a light well in 
this building, which is why the bricks 
look like they belong to the outside.

See through the windows into Room 36 
which is the main co-working area.

name: compost
template:
Put the old mucky filter in the 
black compost bucket with the screw lid on top.

name: measure
template:
Find a large coffee packet in the fridge, 
measure a heaped serving of coffee into 
the small plastic cup and tip it into the filter.

name: replace filter
template:
Replace the filter tray into the coffee machine 
where you took it from.

name: fill water
template:
After you have returned the coffee to the fridge and the cup to the filters 
you can fill up the glass coffee jug with water from the tap.

name: coffee on
template:
If the coffee machine is on there will be an 
orange light and the water will start to boil.

Check the push button switch behind the jug or on the 
3D printer to the left.

A bell will ring when the coffee is made.

name: changebarrel
template:
This is to change the barrel.
Go into the room

name: entercellar
template:
Go into beer cellar (not underground)
switch on the light

name: identifyempty
template:
Look along the float chambers on the wall 
and identify the empty beer barrel.

name: switchoffgas
template: Switch off the gas tap (blue) by rotating 90 degrees

name: reconnectbarrel
template:
Remove plastic cap off new barrel.
Insert connector, twist down and push handle to lock

name: changebarrel
template: Remove and replace empty barrel with same beer

name: switchongas
template: Switch the gas back on at blue tap to pressurise the system

name: refillfloat
template:
Press button on top of float chamber to refill the float chamber.

Press black release button at bottom to release the float ball.

name: done
template: All done.  Turn off the light and leave the room

name: followline
template: Follow the gas/beer line to the barrel that needs to be changed

name: disconnectbarrel
template:
Lift handle in centre of barrel and twist to remove the connector
(this opens to the liquid)

name: start here - STFC
template:
Welcome to the first station of your QuestTour
This will guide you around the STFC Facility.

Poke the Start button with your index 
finger to move on. 

NextButtonDef: intro,Start,

name: end
template:
You are at the end of the Augmented Reality STFC Tour.

Thank you for participating!

We hope you enjoyed this adventure.

Please click Start to begin again for the next person.

NextButtonDef: start,Start,

name: entrance 2 - STFC
template:
We are currently at Entrance 2. This is where our tour will begin.

The next stage is to visit the muster station outside, if conditions outside are not suitable, you can skip this step with the skip button.

NextButtonDef: muster,Start,

NextButtonDef: building,Skip,

name: muster point - STFC
template: Here is Muster Point 3. In the case of an emergency evacuation, such as a fire, please congregate here.

name: building wardens - STFC
template:
Before we continue with the rest of the tour, let's go over the building wardens. Your first point of contact if anything goes wrong during your time here.

There are 3 building wardens:
- Jack Hogarth
- Sean Youd
- Reda Šimbelytė

One of these should be available to help you with any present problems.

name: toilets - STFC
template: The main toilets for the floor are located here

name: accessible toilets - STFC
template: The accessible toilets are also located here. The accessible toilets are open to anyone who may need them.

name: lift - STFC
template:
The lift up to the next floor is located here.

Do not use this in the case of a fire.

name: stairs - STFC
template:
The stairs up to the next floor are located here, use these in the case of a fire.

There is a fire exit located here.

name: stairs fire exit - STFC
template: This is the fire exit for the stairs

name: kitchen - STFC
template:
This is the kitchen on this floor.

Please make sure you keep it tidy, out of respect for our residents and for health and safety reasons.

name: project area - STFC
template:
This is the door to the project area.

This is the main co-working space of the building.

name: project area fire escape - STFC
template:
This is the fire escape for the project area.

If there is a fire in the project area, please exfiltrate through this door.

name: entrance 1 - STFC
template: This is Entrance 1, there is a fire call point and a power shut off button here.

name: prototyping area - STFC
template:
This is the prototyping room.

This room is access controlled.

Be aware that this room is a low oxygen hazard. If the oxygen gets too low in this room, the alarm should sound.

There is also a possible caustic acid hazard in this room.

name: first aid point - STFC
template:
This is the first aid point.

It is recommended to come here for any first aid needs. The first aid point contains:

- A first aid box
- A list of the current first aiders
- An Eye wash station
- The emergency stop switch
- The relevant emergency number

name: first aider offices - STFC
template: In this hallway you'll find the offices of the first aiders.

name: jack office - STFC
template:
This is Jack Hogarth's office, one of the first aiders. 

You can also contact Jack for help with booking meeting rooms.

name: reda office - STFC
template:
This is Reda Šimbelytė's office, another one of the first aiders.

Reda was involved in the creation of this app!

name: append count

template:
This is the payload: {{payload}} !

Here is a a few more lines of text
and so it goes

name: S1
template:
Welcome to the first station of your QuestTour
This will guide you around the DoESLiverpool 
hackspace.
